item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, October 3, 2024 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Image Editing with Gaussian Splatting (132 points | 30 comments)

3. Solving methane mysteries with satellite imagery (41 points | 1 comment)
4. LG Chem develops material capable of suppressing thermal runaway in batteries (18 points | 4 comments)
5. Patent troll Sable pays up, dedicates all its patents to the public (165 points | 53 comments)
6. France's oldest treasure hunt has been solved (104 points | 17 comments)

10. An adult fruit fly brain has been mapped (495 points | 158 comments)

20. In Mexico’s underwater caves, a glimpse of artifacts, fossils and human remains (160 points | 43 comments)
21. Ask HN: What happens to ".io" TLD after UK gives back the Chagos Islands? (135 points | 105 comments)
22. Show HN: Teletxt (Vercel App) (5 points | 2 comments)
23. AMD GPU Inference (255 points | 87 comments)

26. Who Pays for the Arts? (85 points | 189 comments)
27. Cooking items in your home are linked to cancer-causing chemicals (7 points | discuss)
28. Show HN: Bringing multithreading to Python's async event loop (69 points | 17 comments)
29. Filed: WP Engine Inc. v Automattic Inc. and Matthew Charles Mullenweg [pdf] (470 points | 466 comments)
30. The bunkbed conjecture is false (176 points | 56 comments)
